messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I have a gunshot victim here.
Okay, tell me exactly what happened.
He was breaking into the house. I shot him.
What's the phone number you're calling from?
It's [phone number].
How old is he?
He's 30.
Are you with him now?
He's outside. I believe he's shot in the head.
Can you just send somebody here, please?
I need you to tell me what happened, ma'am.
He was breaking into the house.
Do you know who it was?
Yes, that's my roommate.
And how did he get the gunshot wound?
From me.
Where is the gun now?
It's here at the house.
Is he awake?
I don't know. I've not been out there. Please, come on.
Is he breathing?
I don't know, please.
We're going to have somebody sent that way. I just need you to answer my questions as best you can, okay?
Okay.
Is there any way you could go out and check on him?
Yes, I can. Hold on.
If you feel comfortable doing so.
Yes, he's breathing, but he's struggling.
Okay, he is breathing?
Yes.
And where is the gunshot wound?
It's to the head.
Is there any serious bleeding?
Yes, there's bleeding. He's unconscious.
Is there more than one wound?
No, just the one wound.
When did this happen?
Just now.
Is there any way you could put the gun away or lock it up?
Yes, I can do that.
What kind of gun is it?
It's a .22 pistol.
What's your name?
James Lang.
And what's the roommate's name?
Richard Bartlett.
Was he armed or did he have any weapons?
No, no weapons. Just very violent.
If you could just stay on the line for me, I'm going to give the responders some instructions, okay?
Okay.
Are you still there, sir?
Yes.
Were you able to put the gun away?
Yes.
Is there any way you could get outside to the patient with the phone?
No, I don't have a cordless phone.
Is there anybody else there with you?
No, I'm alone.
I need you to get to the patient if able. Lay him flat on his back to keep his airway open.
Okay, I will do that.
If able, get a clean, dry cloth or towel and place it firmly on the wound. Don't lift it up to look.
Okay, I can do that.
Is he still breathing?
Yes, but he sounds like he's gurgling.
We need to keep his airway open. Make sure he is flat on his back with no pillows.
Okay.
Check his mouth for food or vomit.
He's not vomiting.
How long will it be until responders arrive?
They are on their way as quickly as possible.
Don't put direct pressure if there is any visible fracture. Just apply firm pressure around the wound.
There doesn’t appear to be a large amount of blood.
Can you ensure his head is tilted back to maintain the airway?
I can't do that and come back to the phone.
Stay with him and monitor his breathing. Is there no way to bring the phone any closer?
No.
Stay with him and ensure he continues breathing. I'm staying on the line.
Okay.
Are you still there, sir? Hello?
Yes, I'm here.
Is he still breathing?
Yes.
The main thing is to monitor that as best you can. They're here. Thank God.
Stay separated from the weapon.
Okay.
Let me know when they're right there with you.
Do you want me to step to the door?
Let me know when they're with you. Just make sure to stay separated from the gun.
They're on the porch.
If they're there with you, go ahead and step outside.
Should I hold on, or they're asking questions?
If you could just let me know when they're with you and stay separated from the weapon.
